result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra A Shrum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Cooperate with truthful testimony of co-defendants. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: 30 days stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. Sentence can be served during the period of probation as directed by probation agent.

records.addlTxt: from court to defendant indicating he will not be amending JOC. Defendant needs to make arrangments to serve the time with jail staff.
from defendant asking court to amend JOC to allow her to serve her jail sentence a day or two at a time.

Defendant Cassandra A Shrum in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Copy of letter from Innovative Counseling on defendant's behalf.   Student of the Month award for defendant from NWTC.

Defendant Cassandra A Shrum in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. Atty Gerbers asks court to set off sentencing for 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Cassandra A Shrum in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber indicates matter is close to resolving, requests another status in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Cassandra A Shrum in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
